project.name: neural nets
project.notes: Demonstration of neural network blocks for creating, training, monitoring, and using models. Also includes a block that searches for good model architectures.

scene.name: neural nets
scene.notes: Demonstration of neural network blocks for creating, training, monitoring, and using models. Also includes a block that searches for good model architectures.

block-definition.s: Search for good neural net model parameters for %'model name' perform %'number of experiments' experiments with each running %'training cycles' training cycles $nl and when each experiment finishes do %'do when a trial finishes' $nl then process best parameters %'do with best parameters' $nl but if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: This searches for the best hyperparameters (learning rate, number of training cycles, loss function, optimazation method, and layers) that results in the most accurate model. It will run 'do when a trial finishes' with the results of each experiment and after 'number of experiments' it will run 'do with parameters' with the best parameters found. The parameters can then be passed along to the "Create and train a neural net named ... base upon ..." block. The named model must already exist and its training data (and optionally its validation data) already made available.

block-definition.s: Load %'kind of data' data from URL %'URL' $nl and add to any previous data %'add to previous data' ( this is only for %'model name' ) $nl then %'do when data loaded' $nl but if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Loads training or validataion data previously saved using the "tensorflow.js" page opened using the "Open support panel ..." block.

block-definition.s: %'n' random numbers with maximum of %'maximum'
block-definition.comment: Reports a list of 'n' between 1 and 'maximum'. Multiplying and dividing by 1000 produces numbers with 3 decimal places.

block-definition.s: Train model named %'name' %'n' times $nl with learning rate %'learning rate' $nl and shuffle the data %'shuffle' $nl and use %'validation split' of the data for validation $nl then when completed %'process response' $nl or if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Train the model using 'n' learning steps. Each step will change weights by 'learning rate'. If it is too big the learning will fail. If it is too small it will go very slowly. So that the learning doesn't rely upon the order of the data it can be 'shuffled' each step. If validation data hasn't been created then an alternative is to use 'validation split' fraction of the data for validation.

block-definition.s: map %'func' over %'data'
Train model named %'model name' %'n' times $nl then when completed %'do when finished'
block-definition.comment: Train the model using 'n' learning steps. There is a full-featured version of this block.

custom-block.s: Train model named %txt %n times %br with learning rate %n %br and shuffle the data %b %br and use %n of the data for validation %br then when completed %cmdRing %br or if there is an error %cmdRing
inform %txt with title %txt %br ok to repeat same message %b

block-definition.s: Create a neural net model %'model name' $nl with layers %'layers' $nl each input has %'input size' number(s) then %'do when created'
block-definition.comment: Creates a neural with a 'name' that is used in other blocks for training and prediction. 'Layers' is a list of positive numbers determine the size of each layer. 'Input size' should be a number or a list of numbers that describes what the input dimensions are. You don't need to provide this if you have already sent or loaded training data. There is another version of this block with more inputs.

custom-block.s: Create a neural network model %txt %br with layers %l %br using optimizer %txt %br with loss function %txt %br each input has %s number(s) %br then %cmdRing %br but if there is an error %cmdRing
inform %txt with title %txt %br ok to repeat same message %b

block-definition.s: Create a neural network model %'name' $nl with layers %'layers' $nl using optimizer %'optimizer' $nl with loss function %'loss function' $nl each input has %'input size' number(s) $nl then %'do after model created' $nl but if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Creates a neural with a 'name' that is used in other blocks for training and prediction. 'Layers' is a list of positive numbers determine the size of each layer. The 'optimizer' is the name of the method that will be used during training. 'loss function' is used to measure the difference between predictions and outputs during training. 'Input size' should be a number or a list of numbers that describes what the input dimensions are. You don't need to provide this if you have already sent or loaded training data.

inputs.input: Stochastic Gradient DescentStochastic Gradient Descent Adaptive Stochastic Gradient Descent Adaptive Learning Rate Gradiant Descent Adaptive Moment Estimation Adaptive Moment Estimation Max Momentum Root Mean Squared Prop
Mean Squared ErrorAbsolute Distance Compute Weighted Loss Cosine Distance Hinge Loss Huber Loss Log Loss Mean Squared Error Sigmoid Cross Entropy Softmax Cross Entropy

block-definition.s: Get predictions from model(s) %'model name(s)' with inputs %'inputs' $nl then %'process predictions' $nl or if there is an error %'process error' $nl with categories %'categories'
block-definition.comment: Ask the trained model to make predictions for each value in 'inputs'. Can also average the predictions from a list of models.

block-definition.s: Replace model named %'model name' with the best model found $nl and when finished %'run after replacement' $nl but if there is an error %'run if there is an error'
block-definition.comment: This will replace the model named by the best model found by the 'Search for good neural net model ..." command.

block.var: run if there is an error

block-definition.s: Open support panel %'source'
block-definition.comment: Open an interface page for different machine learning models.

inputs.input: training using cameratraining using camera training using microphone posenet tensorflow.js

block-definition.s: Load neural net from URL %'URL' $nl then when loaded %'do when loaded' $nl unless there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Loads a model previously saved using the interface on the 'tensorflow.js' page which can be opened using the 'Open support panel ...' block.

block-definition.s: Send %'kind of data' data input %'input' output %'output' $nl forget old data %'ignore old data' ( this is only for %'model name' ) $nl then when data has been received %'do when finished'
block-definition.comment: Sends either training or validation data to the support panel.

block-definition.s: inform %'message' with title %'title' $nl ok to repeat same message %'ok'
block-definition.comment: Will display 'message' in a dialog box with 'title'. User needs to click 'OK' to remove it. Can supress duplicate messages.

block-definition.s: Create a neural net model %'name' (expert version) $nl with layers %'layers' $nl using optimizer %'optimizer' $nl with loss function %'loss function' $nl with activation function %'activation function' $nl with dropout rate %'dropout rate' $nl each input has %'input size' number(s) $nl then %'do after model created' $nl but if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Creates a neural network with a 'name' that is used in other blocks for training and prediction. 'Layers' is a list of positive numbers determine the size of each layer. The 'optimizer' is the name of the method that will be used during training. 'loss function' is used to measure the difference between predictions and outputs during training. The 'activation function' is applied after the weighted inputs are summed. 'dropout rate' adds some noise to training that helps prevent overfitting to the training data. 'Input size' should be a number or a list of numbers that describes what the input dimensions are. You don't need to provide this if you have already sent or loaded training data.

inputs.input: Stochastic Gradient DescentStochastic Gradient Descent Adaptive Stochastic Gradient Descent Adaptive Learning Rate Gradiant Descent Adaptive Moment Estimation Adaptive Moment Estimation Max Momentum Root Mean Squared Prop
Mean Squared ErrorAbsolute Difference Log Loss Mean Squared Error
reluelu hardSigmoid linear relu relu6 selu sigmoid softmax softplus softsign tanh swish mish

block-definition.s: Get prediction from model(s) %'model names' with input %'input' $nl then %'process prediction' $nl or if there is an error %'process error' $nl with categories %'categories'
block-definition.comment: Ask the trained model to predict what the output should be for the 'input'. There is also a block for computing many predictions all at once. 'Model names' can be a list of names or a single name. Categories should only be provided if the prediction is for labelling the input.

block-definition.s: let %'var' be %'value'
empty? %'data'
load tensorflow

Set TensorFlow support window visualization options $nl graph width: %'width' $nl graph height: %'height' $nl minimum loss: %'minimum loss' $nl maximum loss: %'maximum loss' $nl display graphs: %'display graphs' $nl display layers: %'display layers' $nl display confusion matrices: %'display confusion matrices'
block-definition.comment: This block customises what is seen if the 'Open support panel tensorflow.js" block is run. If 'display graphs' is true then a graph of the loss over each iteration is displayed. You can control its dimensions and the range of values. If 'display layers' is true then statistics about each layer is displayed. If 'display confusion matrices' is true on the output are labels (not numbers) then confusion matrices are displayed.

block-definition.s: inform %'message' with title %'title'
block-definition.comment: Will display 'message' in a dialog box with 'title'. User needs to click 'OK' to remove it.

block-definition.s: Check if %'model name' exists $nl then do %'process answer'
Does %'model name' model exist?
get the %'key' of %'table'
block-definition.comment: Reports the value of the 'key' in a table that is a list of pairs of keys and values.

block-definition.s: Search and replace %'number of replacements' times $nl with number of experiments %'number of experiments' $nl with number of samples %'number of samples' $nl with %'number of training cycles' initial number of training cylces $nl do after each experiment finishes %'when an experiment finishes' $nl do after each replacement %'do with parameters' $nl then finally do %'when finished'

custom-block.s: Search for good neural net model parameters for %txt %br perform %n experiments %br where each experiment should run the same parameters %n times %br where at first run %n training cycles %br and when each experiment finishes do %cmdRing %br then process best parameters %cmdRing %br but if there is an error %cmdRing %br $pointRight-1-64-64-255 Varying these parameters: %br ...optimization method %b %br ...loss function %b %br ...activation function %b %br ...shuffle data %b %br ...learning rate %b %br ...number of training iterations %b %br ...validation split %b %br ...dropout rate %b %br ...number and size of layers %b %br $pointRight-1-64-64-255 With these scoring weights: %br ...loss weight %n %br ...accuracy weight %n %br ...duration weight %n %br ...size of model weight %n %br ...variance of score weight %n %br $pointRight-1-64-64-255 With these initial settings: %br ...learning rate %n %br ...stop training if no progress for %n cycles %br ...fraction set aside for validation from training data %n %br ...shuffle data after each step %b

custom-block.l: Error while searching for good parameters

block-definition.s: Search for good neural net model parameters for %'model name' $nl perform %'number of experiments' experiments $nl where each experiment should run the same parameters %'number of samples' times $nl where at first run %'training cycles' training cycles $nl and when each experiment finishes do %'do when a trial finishes' $nl then process best parameters %'do with best parameters' $nl but if there is an error %'process error' $nl $pointRight-1-64-64-255 Varying these parameters: $nl ...optimization method %'vary optimization method' $nl ...loss function %'vary loss function' $nl ...activation function %'vary activation function' $nl ...shuffle data %'vary whether to shuffle data' $nl ...learning rate %'vary learning rate' $nl ...number of training iterations %'vary number of training iterations' $nl ...validation split %'vary validation split' $nl ...dropout rate %'vary dropout rate' $nl ...number and size of layers %'vary number of layers' $nl $pointRight-1-64-64-255 With these scoring weights: $nl ...loss weight %'loss weight' $nl ...accuracy weight %'accuracy weight' $nl ...duration weight %'duration weight' $nl ...size of model weight %'size weight' $nl ...variance of score weight %'standard deviation weight' $nl $pointRight-1-64-64-255 With these initial settings: $nl ...learning rate %'learning rate' $nl ...stop training if no progress for %'stop if no progress' cycles $nl ...fraction set aside for validation from training data %'validation fraction' $nl ...shuffle data after each step %'shuffle data'
block-definition.comment: This searches for the best hyperparameters (learning rate, number of training cycles, loss function, optimazation method, and layers) that results in the most accurate model. It will run 'do when a trial finishes' with the results of each experiment. Each experiment will average the results of 'number of samples' runs with the same hyperparameters. After 'number of experiments' it will run 'do with parameters' with the best parameters found. The parameters can then be passed along to the "Create and train a neural net named ... base upon ..." block. The named model must already exist and its training data (and optionally its validation data) already made available. It scores each experiment by adding the weighted values of the loss, accuracy, time to train, number of parameter, and degree of variability in the outcome scores.

block-definition.s: process best parameters %'best parameters' %'number of replacements' %'number of experiments' %'number of samples' %'initial training cycles' %'when an experiment finishes' %'do with parameters' %'when finished'

custom-block.s: Replace model named %txt with the best model found %br and when finished %cs %br but if there is an error %cmdRing

Search and replace %n times %br with number of experiments %n %br with number of samples %n %br with %n initial number of training cylces %br do after each experiment finishes %cmdRing %br do after each replacement %cmdRing %br then finally do %cmdRing

custom-block.l: Error while replacing model with best model while searching.

custom-block.s: Search and replace %n times %br with number of experiments %n %br with number of samples %n %br with %n initial number of training cylces %br do after each experiment finishes %cmdRing %br do after each replacement %cmdRing %br then finally do %cmdRing

Search and replace %n times %br with number of experiments %n %br with number of samples %n %br with %n initial number of training cylces %br do after each experiment finishes %cmdRing %br do after each replacement %cmdRing %br then finally do %cmdRing

block-definition.s: call eCraft2Learn reporter %'reporter name' with %'inputs'
Set presentation mode to %'flag'
Open web page %'url'
Load eCraft2Learn library
block-definition.comment: No longer needed in Snap! 7+ but retained to avoid error from blocks that expect it.

block-definition.s: Train model named %'name' %'n' times $nl unless no progress for %'stop after' cycles $nl with learning rate %'learning rate' $nl and shuffle the data %'shuffle' $nl and use %'validation split' of the data for validation $nl and process data in batches of size %'batch size' $nl then when completed %'process response' $nl or if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Train the model using 'n' learning steps. If three is no progress for 'stop after' cycles it will stop early. Each step will change weights by 'learning rate'. If it is too big the learning will fail. If it is too small it will go very slowly. So that the learning doesn't rely upon the order of the data it can be 'shuffled' each step. If validation data hasn't been created then an alternative is to use 'validation split' fraction of the data for validation. The training will process 'batch size' data items all at once.

block-definition.s: Send %'kind of data' data input %'input' output %'output' $nl forget old data %'ignore old data' ( this is only for %'model name' ) $nl then when data has been received %'do when finished' $nl and if the output data are labels use these %'labels'
block-definition.comment: Sends either training or validation data to be used by training blocks. Note that if the output are labels of categories then if you are also providing validation data then provide the same list of labels. Note all data whose output is not one of the labels is automatically removed.

block-definition.s: run eCraft2Learn command %'command name' with %'inputs'
load eCraft2Learn
normalize %'data' $nl then receive normalized data, mean, and variance %'do with result' $nl unless there is an error %'handle error'
block-definition.comment: Normalizing involves computing the mean and variance and then subtracting the mean from all data items and dividing by square root of the variance (i.e. the standard deviation). So the mean of the normalized data should be very near zero and the variance one. Works with lists, lists of lists, lists of lists of lists, etc.

block-definition.s: normalize %'data'
block-definition.comment: Normalizing involves computing the mean and variance and then subtracting the mean from all data items and dividing by square root of the variance (i.e. the standard deviation). So the mean of the normalized data should be very near zero and the variance one. Works with lists, lists of lists, lists of lists of lists, etc. Reports normalized data, mean, and variance so result can be 'unnormalized'.

custom-block.s: normalize %l %br then receive normalized data, mean, and variance %cmdRing %br unless there is an error %cmdRing

block-definition.s: un-normalize data: %'data' mean: %'mean' variance: %'variance'
block-definition.comment: Undoes normalization by multiplying by the standard deviation and adding the mean.

block-definition.s: normalize data: %'data' mean: %'mean' variance: %'variance'
block-definition.comment: Normalizes the data by subtracting the mean and dividing by the standard deviation.

scripts.comment: Creating your own machine learning neural net.

custom-block.s: Create a neural net model %txt %br with layers %l %br each input has %s number(s) then %cs
custom-block.comment: Creates a model where each input value is connected with 100 neurons that are each connected to 50 neurons. Those 50 neurons are then connected to the single output value.

custom-block.s: Create a neural net model %txt (expert version) %br with layers %l %br using optimizer %txt %br with loss function %txt %br with activation function %txt %br with dropout rate %n %br each input has %s number(s) %br then %cs %br but if there is an error %cmdRing
inform %txt with title %txt %br ok to repeat same message %b

custom-block.comment: A full-featured version of the above where you can choose which optimization method, loss function, activation function and dropout rate are used.

custom-block.s: Train model named %txt %n times %br then when completed %cs
custom-block.comment: Train the model. It will adjust neuron weights 50 times to slowly reduce the error.

custom-block.s: Get prediction from model(s) %s with input %s %br then %cmdRing %br or if there is an error %cmdRing %br with categories %l
custom-block.comment: Asking the trained model to predict the output for 10.

scripts.comment: A full-featured version of the above block. You can specify whether the data should be shuffled on each step and whether a fraction of the training data be used only for validation.

custom-block.comment: Read the documentation for parameter search.

scripts.comment: Here is a full-featured version of search.

custom-block.s: Create a neural net model %txt %br with layers %l %br each input has %s number(s) then %cs

custom-block.comment: Create 250 examples to be used for validation instead of treaining.

custom-block.s: Send %txt data input %l output %l %br forget old data %b ( this is only for %txt ) %br then when data has been received %cs

custom-block.comment: With a thousand numbers between 0 and 40 it has enough data to do a good job.

custom-block.s: Send %txt data input %l output %l %br forget old data %b ( this is only for %txt ) %br then when data has been received %cs

Search for good neural net model parameters for %txt perform %n experiments with each running %n training cycles %br and when each experiment finishes do %cmdRing %br then process best parameters %cmdRing %br but if there is an error %cmdRing
inform %txt with title %txt %br ok to repeat same message %b

custom-block.comment: This will do only 3 searches to find parameters that reduces prediction errors the most. It doesn't work that well. If you have time try this again with a much larger number. 20 experiments works pretty well but you might need to go have lunch or go for a walk while it searches.

An illustration of the use of the "Search for good neural net model parameters" block that searches for the best neural net model parameters. Here we test it to see if it can learn to approximate square roots. We start with a model with 40 neurons connected to a layer of 10 connected to 1 (the output).

custom-block.s: Load neural net from URL %txt %br then when loaded %cmdRing %br unless there is an error %cmdRing
custom-block.comment: Load a model trained to estimate 2*n+1.

custom-block.s: Load %txt data from URL %txt %br and add to any previous data %b ( this is only for %txt ) %br then %cmdRing %br but if there is an error %cmdRing
custom-block.comment: Load training or validation data previously saved by opening the support panel called 'tensorflow.js'.

custom-block.s: Get predictions from model(s) %txt with inputs %l %br then %cmdRing %br or if there is an error %cmdRing %br with categories %l
custom-block.comment: Categories should be provided if model output are labels and not numbers.

scripts.comment: Asking for three predictions in one go. Notice that there wasn't enough training data to deal well with negative numbers.

custom-block.s: Search for good neural net model parameters for %txt %br perform %n experiments %br where each experiment should run the same parameters %n times %br where at first run %n training cycles %br and when each experiment finishes do %cmdRing %br then process best parameters %cmdRing %br but if there is an error %cmdRing %br $pointRight-1-64-64-255 Varying these parameters: %br ...optimization method %b %br ...loss function %b %br ...activation function %b %br ...shuffle data %b %br ...learning rate %b %br ...number of training iterations %b %br ...validation split %b %br ...dropout rate %b %br ...number and size of layers %b %br $pointRight-1-64-64-255 With these scoring weights: %br ...loss weight %n %br ...accuracy weight %n %br ...duration weight %n %br ...size of model weight %n %br ...variance of score weight %n %br $pointRight-1-64-64-255 With these initial settings: %br ...learning rate %n %br ...stop training if no progress for %n cycles %br ...fraction set aside for validation from training data %n %br ...shuffle data after each step %b
inform %txt with title %txt %br ok to repeat same message %b

scripts.comment: Here we illustrate how to use the best model found above.

custom-block.s: Replace model named %txt with the best model found %br and when finished %cs %br but if there is an error %cmdRing
inform %txt with title %txt %br ok to repeat same message %b
custom-block.l: Switching to the best model found.

custom-block.comment: CLICK THIS TO OPEN THE HELP PAGE

custom-block.s: Train model named %txt %n times %br unless no progress for %n cycles %br with learning rate %n %br and shuffle the data %b %br and use %n of the data for validation %br and process data in batches of size %n %br then when completed %cmdRing %br or if there is an error %cmdRing
inform %txt with title %txt %br ok to repeat same message %b
Send %txt data input %l output %l %br forget old data %b ( this is only for %txt ) %br then when data has been received %cs %br and if the output data are labels use these %l
custom-block.comment: Sending 5 training data items which are simply examples of 2*n+1
A demonstration that the normalization of normalized data has a mean very close to zero and variance very close to one.

Normalizing involves computing the mean and variance and then subtracting the mean from all data items and dividing by square root of the variance (i.e. the standard deviation). Works with lists, lists of lists, lists of lists of lists, etc.

custom-block.comment: Make sure we are in edit mode.

custom-block.s: Set TensorFlow support window visualization options %br graph width: %n %br graph height: %n %br minimum loss: %n %br maximum loss: %n %br display graphs: %b %br display layers: %b %br display confusion matrices: %b
custom-block.comment: This controls what is displayed if you run the 'Open support panel tensorflow.js" block.
Open up a page where you can create new models, train them, and use them for predictions. Also provides an interface for saving and loading models and training data.

custom-block.s: normalize %l %br then receive normalized data, mean, and variance %cmdRing %br unless there is an error %cmdRing
custom-block.comment: A demonstration of how normalization followed by un-normalization approximately restores the data.
A reporter for normalizing when you know the mean and variance.
